intro: Baccharis saliens, commonly known as the coastal baccharis, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of South America. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is adapted to saline and sandy soils, making it a common sight in coastal dunes and scrublands. It plays a role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for local wildlife. Its resilience to coastal conditions makes it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
